posts.post_content: If you cast a card "without paying its mana cost," you can't pay any alternative costs. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. <--- this rule makes me happy =)

Posted By: __Silence__ (6/11/2011 9:12:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The closest thing to a Planeswalker for madness/threshold decks.
  
However my madness deck is red and black, so not as good as it could be.. but still very awesome.
  
It only lets me discard once per turn as a sorcery, and its ability only benefits red cards, but said ability does hit for 1/5th of your life!
  
Plus the added benefit that all planeswalkers give.... being a target that isn't you!
  
   
Flat out amazing for burn decks.
  
   
The potential to draw new cards is a nice touch too. As well as procing madness on everything.

posts.post_content: What's nice about Chandra Ablaze is she's really an ungraded form of Nalaar both cards have certain aspects that some times make one more favorable to have than the other. I know some people say she's not really good for burn and your right in my book burn is only part of her function. The plus one ability works on ANY red card. If your had is full with burn spells whats the point maybe one or two extra damge and some more mana to use on something else (which if you think about it isn't that bad of a deal really) but if you get a junky one drop creature that's a 1/1 haste you can turn it into 4 damage instead or something else along those lines.

posts.post_content:
First off, just make sure you have mana acceleration and that you can protect her. After that, [Chandra Ablaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Ablaze), then [Sphinx-Bone Wand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx-Bone Wand), next turn [Eye of the Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of the Storm) and go-go dear Chandra ultimatum!  
  
Recasting as few as three red instants and/or sorceries amounts to 45 damage. Recasting 6, which is a more probable number in such a deck amounts to a nice 378 damage. And that's only [Sphinx-Bone Wand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx-Bone Wand) damage. Not counting possible additional damage from the 21 red spells that 'll actually resolve. Do the math. And rejoice...
posts.html:

Posted By: Blackshayde (10/12/2012 8:52:56 AM)

posts.post_content: I hardly ever see anyone running this card in EDH, and I think it has to be because of misunderstanding. It's the only card in the game where you can make each player discard their hand and draw only 3 cards. Have you seen the size of some peoples' hands in EDH? It's not uncommon to see a table full of 7 card hands well into turn 7 and 8. If you're the one guy who always plays down to 3 or less by that time, this basically makes each opponent discard ~4 cards each, and should probably be played in a lot of decks just on that basis alone. Forget the other abilities. So no, this isn't necessarily as build-around-me as it looks. You don't have to run into the arms of Squee, Goblin Nabob just because you put this in.
posts.html:
